Reviews.Title: “Best service and value in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: pkitano
Reviews.Content: We found Club Quarters using Priceline for a reasonable $110/night to stay at their WTC location. When we arrived at midnight from the West Coast, the clerk mentioned they were overbooked, and shuttled us over to the close-by Wall Street location. Best, they compensated by providing a free weekend night voucher, which we used two nights later. Since we were a family of four, Bridget, manager of the Wall St CQ, booked us a suite at Midtown. Since our arrival (and despite the free night), Kevin Chan and Stephen provided the best personalized service. It helps the hotel is small and allows management to be less harried than the Hiltons of Manhattan. Please ask for them, Kevin is a new manager, and makes sure everything is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, good location.”
Reviews.Author: MissVanessa00
Reviews.Content: Service was good, nice location, small awkward room, and shower needs to be re-tiled or have the grout given a really good cleaning (the rest of the bathroom was fine, clean and modern.) Wi-Fi is included, bottled water is also as nice touch. Full dining/room service/bar in the private lounge downstairs, but we didn't bother with it. There are too many exciting places to eat in the city! But really, our room lay out was awful. I'm not really sure what the idea was, but it wasn't working. Oh yes. Its noisy, but then, that is New York. In particular, there is a parking garage across the street that buzzes like a fire alarm every time a car comes out... I slept just fine, my partner had a more difficult time.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for weekend in the city”
Reviews.Author: bucktheiguana
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on 45th Street between Fifth and Sixth avenues. It's within walking distance of the Rockefeller Center subway station and Bryant Park. The rooms are small (like most New York hotels) and the floor layout is confusing. But, you get a comfortable room and great service at a reasonable price. If you have bags, watch out because you have to go up a set of stairs and there's no bellhop service. (Note there is a small elevator for accessiblity that will let you bypass the stairs.) Breakfast buffet is good and they do have bar service at night, though it does close before midnight. Also, for taxis, you'll want to go to Fifth or Sixth avenues as 45th is not a two-way street and most of the taxis are prowling the avenues for fares. Also note that my taxi from Penn Station dropped me off at the corner of 45th & Sixth Ave., giving me a bit of a walk, though I did opt for this to reduce stress for all concerned. Overall, it's a great place to stay in the city and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: JustVixen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Club Quarters in Midtown for one night on a last minute trip to New York. The room was the cheapest I could get last minute so I was a little concerned of what I would be walking in to. I was pleasantly surprised. The room had everything I needed and even though I had a 6:30 appointment the next morning they were nice enough to hold my bags until 1:30 when it was time for me to leave for the airport. I guess if I had to list a negative it would be the room is very very small. For example, I don't think two people could pass each other between the bed and the desk unless they both turned sideways. The bathroom was very small too and not as clean as I would have liked it to be. But overall it was more than I expected and suitable for one night. I couldn't have stayed there for more than 3 without becoming claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: NPOConsultant
Reviews.Content: Club Quarters is developing a reputation for good properties in major cities at below rack rate prices, especially if you're a corporate member. I'm not, but I paid $149 for this room, surely one of the best values in midtown Manhattan. Room was small but perfectly appointed. Only downside was noise from garbage trucks before dawn, but that can be true anywhere in the city, and I six floors up. Lovely executive lounge plus restaurant are available just steps from Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Billing”
Reviews.Author: Annette J
Reviews.Content: CHECK YOUR BILLING! I upgraded my room from a single to a queen, which of course is an additional charge. When I checked my bank account, I was charged an additional $35 fee. They charged me a cancellation fee, thinking I had cancelled the single room. After 2-3 phone calls, I was able to get the charge refunded. Overall, nothing negative to say about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: dyanna26
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the CQ while traveling alone on business. It had everything I could possibly need on a quick trip such as mine. I was happy with the quick and friendly check-in, and the cleanliness of the room. I had a room facing the street, so there was a bit of noise during the week, but I'm not fussy and it didn't bother me too much. The wall mounted flat screen worked fine, wifi was okay, and room was small, but functional. I would consider this CQ if I were coming for a personal visit, due to the great location and value.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent”
Reviews.Author: Angelina_Serra
Reviews.Content: Was happily surprised with the hotel. Nice quiet location away from Times Square. The room we got was update, although with two twin beds. The bathroom was small but acceptable. No two double beds in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, free bottled water!”
Reviews.Author: MITraveler02
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this CQ for a girls weekend. We had a room on the end of the hall with plenty of room. The bathroom was small, but for NYC this hotel was just fine. The location is perfect - close to shopping and the Rockefeller Center area. The hotel provides free bottled water which I took advantage of every day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Reasonable Rooms, A Few Glitchs”
Reviews.Author: ALANW28970
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at CQ Midtown many times and appreciate the comfortable rooms and friendly staff. The location can't be beat, and the refurbished lounge is a comfortable place to do work or to have a complimentary cup of coffee. Two problems, however: 1) free wireless is very slow: 2) it takes an age to retrieve checked luggage (a problem I also encountered at a CQ in Chicago)--best to plan for a 10-15 minute wait.

Reviews.Title: “small but clean and well appointed”
Reviews.Author: Beingblonde
Reviews.Content: Shared a room with my neice, tiny even by NYC standards but clean and had evrything you would need and a very reasonable price. An excellent location for theater, shopping. Free wifi! I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hits and Misses”
Reviews.Author: PinguinVA
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on a business trip in January 2012. First the plusses: efficient, friendly service at both the front desk and in the restaurant, where I had lunch. There is a very large, inviting room with computers for internet access and/or reading and relaxing. The midtown location is very convenient to both Penn and Grand Central Stations, Times Square, Broadway. Rockefeller Center and just about anywhere in Midtown. The minuses: rooms are small (the size of my bathroom was on par with what you would find on a cruise ship), furniture is spartan, no iron or ironing board in the room, flat-panel TV only received about 1/4 of the channels, typical late night noise with garbage trucks at 4:00 a.m. I got a great deal on this stay using Hotels.com and would stay here again if I got a similar deal next time. But there are definitely other properties at the same price point in Midtown to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Well Maintained, but rooms were very small”
Reviews.Author: Shelly1962
Reviews.Content: Rooms were extremely small, but well maintained. Staff was very accomodating. Location was great. Walking distance to numerous attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit in 5 years and the hotel is still great.”
Reviews.Author: SoloTx
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness I booked a 3 night, 4 day long weekend (12/9 - 12/12) this past summer as the hotel was sold out! Best rates for size of the room, cleanliness, warm and welcoming staff, and location in NYC for Christmas! I first discovered Club Quarters through my company and have stayed at a Chicago location, London's financial location and this midtown location - they are solid business class accomodations in lovely buildings. I'll use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: beach bum in ohio
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here Dec. 2011 for a weekend. In short, it's just ok. The lobby is very small and you check yourself in and out. They had a guy there to take your luggage but that's about it. Nobody helps you in and out the doors, there's no real concierge, and nobody to help you hail a taxi if you have your hands full. We arrived very early and they kept our bags for free while we went out and about. We could have checked in early for an extra $30. The room itself was very small with a double bed. The bathroom is also very small and the sliding door doesn't connect to anything at the bottom, so you don't get very much privacy in the bathroom. We didn't have an iron in our room and had to ask twice for one to be delivered to our room. The bed was pretty hard but we were so tired that we didn't notice much. There's a desk in the room and free wi-fi, which we didn't use. You have to go to the ice machine on the 2nd floor to get an ice bucket but nobody tells you that. We discovered it on our own. They do offer free bottled water on every other floor. They heavily advertise the Terrace bar and restaurant as a perk for both Club Quarters and the Jewel, which is 2 doors down and a sister hotel. However, on our first night, we were told the bar was closed for a private party. The second night, a Saturday, the bar closed at 10 pm. So, it's not much of an amenity if you just want to have a night cap. The hotel is across the street from Rockefeller Center and on the same block as Radio City, so it's in a convenient spot if that's what you're looking for. Upon checking out, we found that they had charged us $15 a day for an extra person. We booked the room initially for 2 people. We were told when we checked out that the room we booked was for 1 person only. At $279/nt and with an extra person fee and an early check-in charge, this hotel seems to be milking travelers. There are better deals and better hotels to be had in Midtown West. Earlier this year I stayed at the Royalton and loved it. I still recommend it over Club Quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, But....”
Reviews.Author: DGandSAG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Club Quarters because of its location in Midtown Manhattan, just a short walk from our business meetings. Although the hotel was conveniently located, it left a lot to be desired. On the plus side, the common areas on the main floor were very attractive and spacious high-ceilinged rooms. The sitting room near the front desk had plenty of comfortable, old-fashioned chairs placed right near floor plugs where it was easy to plug in our laptop and phone and do some work in relative peace and quiet. The breakfast room next to it had plenty of room for private chats at the well-spaced tables. The cold buffet breakfast ($13.95 per person, including tax and tip) was perfectly adequate but nothing special and not a real value. Although we didn't sample the hot breakfast buffet, it also didn't seem to be anything special. Our room was smallish and not as well-equipped as we might have imagined for a "business" hotel room. Reading lights by the bed were fine but lighting in the rest of the room was fairly dim. Although the bed itself seemed fairly new and was nicely modern in style, it also was somewhat lumpy and the pillows were soft, not firm. There was only a small area for hanging clothes near the entry door, but no armoire or closet. Also, the bathroom was on the small side and the toilet didn't always flush properly. One definite caution about this hotel: like many places in New York, garbage pick-up lasts for a good while on the street below -- and in this case, even eight floors above the street, the noise lasted for nearly an hour and kept us wide awake between 3:00 and 4:00 AM. The "gym" in the basement was limited, to say the least -- just a treadmill, some medicine balls, a few mats, some candy machines, and that was about it. We were told that the room will be expanded in the near future, but for us, it was a disappointment -- we were expecting a whole lot more. While we could have had a more complete workout at a nearby club, we just didn't feel like going outside the hotel in the cold weather and buying a $15 day pass to use those facilities. Finally, service here was inconsistent. On the plus side, the person who checked us in was friendly and eager to please, but on the down side, the night crew didn't bring us an extra blanket as we'd requested, and when they finally showed up nearly 90 minutes later and banged on our door, we'd already gone to sleep. So, unfortunately, this was not a place that we'd run back to anytime soon; we'd rather stay somewhere else on our next trip and have a more enjoyable visit.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Bigkahuna10
Reviews.Content: I read so many bad reviews for this property and I am not sure why. I am a meeting planner and I stay all over the world. Frst off the staff at the hotel could not have been more pleasant. The rooms are small, but I have stayed at the Hudson Hotel and their rooms are smaller, besides if you are in your room while in NY, hello why....Get out and explore the city, why are you there , to sit in your room! The elevators are not as slow as they say. I went up and down a totla of5 times and I only waited 30 seconds at best. Our temp in the room was just fine. As a matter of fact we did noT turn the heat or the air on and we were there Dec 13th. You can get a full American breakfast for 16.00 a person, not bad for NY. They also have a bar in the lounge, so ifnyou want a night cap you are all set. Coffee makers in tshe room and coffee service in the lounge for no additional fee. Close to all walking attractions. Not sure what else you wuld want. Book the really good rate and enjoy yourself, after all your in NY!

Reviews.Title: “simple, not fancy, but perfect location”
Reviews.Author: fijoh
Reviews.Content: As might be expected in New York,or any major city, the rooms are on the small side and the facilities in the rooms are no better than average, but our room was clean and serviced regularly every day of our 4 night stay. The decor was simple and a bit old fashioned and on the 13th floor we had to wait a while for the hot water to come through. We also waited quite a while some days for the lifts (elevators) as one was constantly out of use. On the up side the staff were friendly and helpful, and the hotel lounge was comfortable and offered free internet access through 2 pcs which were available more often than not. We visited at a busy and expensive time in the city - first weekend after the Xmas lights went on and this hotel was the only one we could find with reasonable rates - not sure we would have stayed here in preference to other choices at a less expensive time. That said it is an excellent location - very central, situated between 5th and 6th Avenues but not overly noisy. One word of warning - the hotel offers fixed price cars to the airports on leaving but the prices they quote are not the same as quoted by the driver when you get in the car. Little you can do about that when you have a plane to catch!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and stay!”
Reviews.Author: LadieLavender
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night. The hotel was very nice and we loved our room. It was very quite and safe. The hotel is in a great location. Just a couple blocks from Times Square and lots of shopping!

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: swiss1968
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel, just two steps far from Time Square and behind the famous 5th Avenue. I stayed in a double room for two persons (as in the past I stayed in a double for 1 person but it was really tiny), quite (although you are in the hearth of NY) with a very large king bed. Room very well cleaned also the bathroom. Check-in very speedy, thks also for the friend support of the front desk. You can have your breakfast (american or continental) in the hotel (not expensive) for a good price. If you want to stay in midtown I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Standard chain room, good location, poor exercise room”
Reviews.Author: cwaters
Reviews.Content: I stay at this chain while in NYC - first time at this site (4in NYC). Affordable, 3 blocks from Times Square. Bed was great. You can bypass the counter for checkin & checkout by using the automated kiosks. I travel 3-4 nights per week, so exercise is important. This ite has the worst exercise room in NYC. One treadmill and weighted balls. Their other NYC sites have an elliptical as well. However - I have seen many low cost NYC hotels with no exercise facilities, but this chain targets business travelers. Had breakfast acros the street at the Cafe Manhattan. Good food but awful coffee.

Reviews.Title: “New York ClaSSIC”
Reviews.Author: k g
Reviews.Content: Its a good location. Its a small room. It provides all you need. Its an average (expensive) price. Well, that is hotels in NYC!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: eamorgan
Reviews.Content: This is my second time here and I love the location--walking distance from Grand Central and to Times Square and Rockefeller center. The room size is very good for a NYC hotel. It is a converted apartment building, so you get a sense of NYC architecture 40 years ago , with modern style. The only downside is the sliding door to the bathroom--watch your fingers.

Reviews.Title: “Proud to be a member of the "Club"”
Reviews.Author: 2Travelers2go
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in Midtown. The facility is well-kept and doesn't look like a hotel from the outside - which suits me fine. If you are looking for hotel-style amenities and want people to "serve" you and a full concierge, CQ is not for you. What CQ is: a well-maintained building with rooms that are clean, functional and appointed with the basics. This particular room had a queen sized bed, two small nightstands, a small chair, desk/chair, flat screen TV, coffee maker, alarm clock and a small closet which would hold a couple of small suitcases and enough hanging space for coats, etc. Bathroom was clean and big enough -- shower stall (no tub) with plenty of hot water and pressure. They give you a small bottle of shampoo, bars of face/hand soap and lotion. The elevators were always prompt - you need to use your key card to get them to work. The room was quiet but without any view - who cares, though, if you are out and about all day and return after dark. The lobby area is very nice, plenty of chairs to lounge in while you are waiting for others, and a computer area. Also with a small bar with limited operating hours. The front desk staff are pleasant and efficient - greeting you with a smile. They will also store your luggage upon check-out which is helpful if you aren't leaving until later in the day. There is a restaurant downstairs which serves continental breakfast on weekends for $11, but there are enough other places within walking distance to get breakfast. This CQ is close to both the bus and train stations for those who are traveling light. You can easily walk to Times Square and the theater district or subway stops. Lots of shopping on Madison Avenue. There is a 24-hour Duane Reade around the corner, if you forgot something or a Jack's variety/discount store right across the street. The "Little Italy" pizza place across the street serves up a pretty decent slice if you want a quick snack. Overall this hotel reflects what it is - geared towards the business traveler and weekenders looking for basic accomodations. I would not advise it for families with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Deborah M
Reviews.Content: The length of my stay was three days and the trip was for pleasure, not business. My reservation was for a Standard Room, which featured a fairly uncomfortable twin-size bed. For NYC Standards, this small room is large. The bathroom only has a shower, but the water was hot and the water pressure decent (but not great). I requested and received a high floor away from the elevators. The building is fairly quiet, although I could hear the crying infant one flight above me. When I requested additional coffee for my coffee maker and towels, the staff was quick to respond to my needs. I didn't use the gym, so cannot give any helpful comments, nor did I eat the hotel's food. The lobby has a very comfortable lounging area with two computers that can be used for 30 minutes -- there are printers for the exclusive use of printing out your airline boarding pass. This location is very central to the city -- a 10 minute walk to Grand Central. There are additional blankets, pillows, and iron and ironing board in the hallway. The hotel is going 'green', so they have reusable water bottles that you can fill with chilled water to take back to your room. All in all, for a NYC Hotel, it's quite good. Rates change with seasonal demand.

Reviews.Title: “Once you get inside you'll see how nice it is.”
Reviews.Author: thepinheiros
Reviews.Content: By looking from the street you wouldn't tell it is a nice hotel. But it is! The room is very NICE. We stayed at a Club Size Room and it was great. The check-in is done electronically. Sweet! Staff was very nice. They even let me use their phone to contact a shuttle company at 5am! No one to help you with your luggage - which for me was perfect - but some people will find it weird. Totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great if long stays room is not a priority”
Reviews.Author: sandycec
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Club Quarters Midtown for 2 nights. The hotel is one of the typical narrow buildings sandwiched between two other buildings - what else would you expect in downtown NYC? The person at the desk was very courteous and offered us suggestions for dining etc. The rooms are tiny (again Downtown NY this is what you would get mostly). It was a confined space to say the least. The solitary window was small and above the air conditioner and was in a corner. So if you really want to see outside the room you would have to lean over the A/C and crane your neck (not the the view of the west 45th street is something you would want to be seeing for hours anyway). My only main gripe was that the bathroom door had no locks. It was a sliding door - to save space ofcourse but that doesn't mean it shouldn't have a lock. Other than that everything else was great. It was very quiet in the lobby as well as inside the room (though you can hear the garbage truck come after midnight and might bother you if you are light sleeper - but again, you would expect such things in a big city). But the location of the hotel was just fabulous. Near to Times Sqaure, walking distance to Radio City Music hall, close to 5th avenue etc. We happened to be there during brazil day and the avenue of americas was just wild with a huge crowd partying with road side shops etc. Lots of dining options nearby and quite a few deli shops next to the hotel for that morning coffee and breakfast. The hotel does give free coffee and more importantly free bottled water (which was a precious thing if sightseeing NYC on a warm day like we did during the 2011 Labor day). Overall, I would recommend this place for those who want a nice place close to Times Square (and all the activity) and just come to the room at night to get some rest before heading out again.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal in a good location”
Reviews.Author: SGECHAMPION
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at a Club Quarters (CG) in NYC. A few years ago we stayed at their Wall Stret location, this time in midtown. Hotel price levels in NYC have risen sharply since our last visit in the spring of 2010, so we were happy to have found this good deal, at $259 per night. The location can hardly be beat; the hotel is near Grand Central, within two blocks of several subway lines, and a short stroll to Times Square. Our check-in and check-out were super efficient, while the wait for the two elevators was always long. Our room on the 12th floor was small, but more than sufficient for us; who spends a lot of time in a hotel room in NYC when there is so much going on? The bed was comfortable, a bit on the hard side. The bathroom was clean, but we thought the shower pressure was dismal; maybe it was because we were on the 12th of 13 floors. Wireless internet was slow and service sporadic; I wanted to follow a European soccer game online, but gave up after a while. A Starbucks and several delis are nearby, so we opted not to have breakfast at CQ. We checked out the breakfast buffet and felt it was not too "comprehensive". So overall we considered CQ a good overnight choice in an expensive city, but it's probably more suited for leisure travelers than businessmen.

Reviews.Title: “Not the way to treat your guests”
Reviews.Author: PerantauDunia
Reviews.Content: Firstly - I am writing this review as a business traveller and what I expect from an establishment catering for business travellers. Good: Value and Location. Close to everywhere you want to go to in mid-town and for the price, it is excellent value no doubt. BAD: My PA booked here for 2 weeks due to its location and value. I work for a big organisation and travel for work all the time and I have never encountered a hotel that appears not to care at all about its business client - I am making this statement as thinking about it, if it's not taking care of their business clients, I dread to think how they treat their other clients! 1st Flaw: When I checked in, they said they were overbooked and said if I don't mind going to a small room, which happened to be a tiny box room with no windows. OK - I don't mind this that much to be honest as when I go backpacking I stay at hostels, but I am here for business and you do expect some level of standard. 2nd Flaw: The next day I was given another room as promised, but when I went into the room, there is a note waiting on the table effectively saying "Welcome, this room may be noisy so here's some complimentary ear plugs to help you sleep"!. I have NEVER in my 7 years of business travel encountered anything like this. I attach a picture of the note here as I am sure many people would think I am lying or exaggerating. 3rd Flaw: Tried to charge me an extra night without putting it on the Invoice- The next day I asked if I could change rooms as it was noisy and I found it difficult to sleep and they said there was nothing they can do as there's no other rooms available. So I arranged to stay at another hotel and when I spoke to someone on the phone, they confirmed I can check out without being charged. When I checked out they didn't charge me as promised....... Guess what when I checked my credit card the week after? They charged an extra night without even bothering to call or email me or my PA! Lucky that I check my credit card. I find this very sneaky and unprofessional of them. In summary, I would have given them 1 star but for the location and value (it is actually very cheap), but I think if they don't even provide basic common sense level of treatment of service for business travellers, what chance would individual non-business travellers have?

Reviews.Title: “So Glad I Didn't Pay For This Trip Myself”
Reviews.Author: TickyTackyM
Reviews.Content: Very small room reeking of cigarettes. The staff helpfully sprayed it up with deodorizer. No bar or restaurant, but there's a lounge section where they keep coffee and water and computers and chairs. Often, the trash receptacles were overflowing and it looked ridiculous and unsightly. Great staff at the front desk with a marginally competent facilities staff. No one EVER cleaned my room in three days. It's not like I was wrecking the place, so it didn't bother me. But I've been to many hotels and they've all cleaned the rooms unless I said not to. Weird. Stupid gym. Super small with two walking machines and a cheap bike. The screen on the bike was dim as the batteries were dying. After my workout, I made note of this to a facilities guy who had no batteries to replace with. I had to help him understand how to take the battery cover off. Awesome refillable water bottles in the gym. I took an armful back to my room and drank water all night. The view was the brick wall of the building next door. Had to wait a million years for the small elevator to pick me up every single time. They leave a utilities closet wide open so that you can get your own shampoo, etc. I know that's their thing, but it's freaky. My job paid for the room but they still took $50 off my card for all the things I MIGHT DO while staying there. That's probably normal, but I didn't like it. Lousy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jefinur
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here last week -- the hotels I usually stay in while in New York were all $600+, so $250 at Club Quarters was a bargain. I was alone, so staying in a small room (twin bed) was not an issue. There was a small window with a view of a a fire escape - I peeked out once and then closed the curtains. The bathroom is small but fine -- note that the amenities do not include a separate hair conditioner. The shampoo is a "conditioning shampoo," which was okay, but I would have brought my own conditioner had I known. I read some of the other reviews that complained about a spotty wifi connection, but I did not have any problems with it. Overall, it was comfortable and definitely a bargain. Plus, you cannot beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing but convenient”
Reviews.Author: kirstyj4
Reviews.Content: I've just spent four nights at this location which I found very convenient. However, I think the hotel needs to raise its game - the internet connections were weak, and almost unusable in the rooms; the lifts were slow and often one of the two lifts were often out of order; many of the rooms are pokey and dark - I had to look at a couple before I found one that was satisfactory; the bathroom was hardly cleaned each day - looked like toilets and sinks were wiped down but not cleaned thoroughly; the only lobby space was rented out for events every night, so there was no proper place to sit in the evening. We were staying at an expensive time so it wasn't good value for money. One plus point was the availability of coffee, tea and water in the lobby. As there was no facility for feedback, this is the only way I could make my views known!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadBklyn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently with a friend - booked the executive suite so one of us could use the sofa bed. As with all Club Quarters (at least the ones I've stayed at - St. Paul's London and Washington DC) the room was small, but adequate. The "suite" did have a separate bedroom and living room, although rooms pretty much on top of one another. Bathroom is off bedroom so guest on sofa bed has to go through bedroom to use -this may not work well for some visitors. Bathroom tiny overall, but shower a decent size. Room and hallways clean. Sofa bed was comfy, sheets crisp and clean. Would be better if CQ provided a duvet for the sofa bed instead of not so great looking blankets. This CQ has a pleasant lounge/bar area downstairs (it is situated in the Midtown Executive Club) and we enjoyed having that extra space to sit and chat, especially since rooms are on the small side. Lounge has computers with fast, free wifi access. While staying we enjoyed a quick lunch at the Cafe Manhattan, right across the road. Good place for a salad or sandwich. Didn't seem to be open for breakfast on Sunday, so we went to the kosher deli place on the same block. That was fast and good value for money. Hotel is in an excellent central location. Friendly and helpful staff. If you want a decent place to stay and aren't looking for a lot of large lobby/hotel gift shop/extensive amenities then this will be a good place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the $”
Reviews.Author: Jon D
Reviews.Content: i was unsure of this place the first time i stayed at a club quarters. I thought to myself "club who???" but the first time i stayed at the wall street nyse location. it was great. staff was friendly. room was nice and CLEAN and the price was right. so when i booked club quarter midtown i was not as afraid. guess what....it was the same experience. the room looked identical to the wall street location. the hotel staff was nice. i even tried the restaurant and it was good for breakfast. i think this place is an historical landmark or on some historical registry. my top comforter seemed a bit soiled (eewww). I called the front desk and they changed it immediately. everything was clean as best as it could be. that's the main thing for me and they achieved it. the location was absolutely AWESOME. I could literally walk to times square but the hotel is on a side street so it's not like you're seeing flashing lights. definitely book here. it's really good and i'm excited to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the location”
Reviews.Author: CTTraveler30
Reviews.Content: Near 5th Avenue and Times Square, it's a bargain! Rooms are small but well-furnished, great for a solo business traveler. Breakfast buffet had good food, but it took them a while to find someone working the dining room - the only time that the service was less than excellent. One nice touch - though checkout was at noon, my business in the city kept me until after 4pm, but the hotel provided a free baggage check service.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place for solo traveler, clean and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: IsraelAndreyka
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay, clean room, stayed there in single room and got much more that expected. The room is not so small and very comfortable. Very close to time square and in good location that close to everything. Very recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Standard facilities at great midtown location”
Reviews.Author: Budgettraveler58
Reviews.Content: I stayed with two daughters in a short weekend stay in NYC. Location is great for Times Sq., Bway shows and Radio City. Although 45th st. between 5th Avenue and Avenue of the Americas can be a little dark, lonely and intimidating at night coming back from the shows specially with two teen daughters. The room we stayed in was small even for NYC standards while the bathroom was extremely small (reminded us of basic cruise bathrooms with literaly no division between shower and toilet. I do not think I would come back to this hotel as facilities are also scarce. However, the price was reasonable given that you are in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean But Small Rooms, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: RedCamOp
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice, clean, comfortable, well decorated, and organized for such a small space. The staff was friendly and helpful, overall a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but small rooms - I mean really small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cgyguy30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at CQ for Business a few times and have to say, it's not my first choice. Not because of the rooms or staff. The staff are great, the rooms are definitely updated. It is the size of rooms. The door barely clears the bed when you walk in. They are probably 1/3 of a normal hotel room and even though you are in NYC, this is not normal. I've stayed at other brand hotels in NYC which are the same price and substantially bigger. However; if you don't care about size, then this hotel meets all criteria. Even in the elevator you almost need to turn sideways. Also, with the small rooms cause noise from the elevator (the bing sound) and people talking.

Reviews.Title: “They took more Money!”
Reviews.Author: Marco1000000
Reviews.Content: I booked it trough Booking.com. At the end I had cancellation of my flight, so I couldn't be there. On Booking.com there was written that the Total cancellation cost was one night ($129), but they then took $151, adding night taxes for being in NY. I haven't been there so I asked to remove these additinal costs and respect the info on Booking.com, but they didn't take care and they charged me for $151. I don't think it is fair! Moreover other hotels in case of these obstacles for reaching the hotel, understand and they don't charge you at all. I like more this kind of hotels!!!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: priscilla00
Reviews.Content: At first I was really concerned due to the reviews previously posted. But since I was staying in NYC for just a weekend, thought it would be good to give it a shot. Don't regret at all. Nice Staff, EXCELLENT location. I got the standard room and it was perfect. Nice and clean room, not small at all. Ok, there was a little noise during the night, but it was not enough to complain about. God, you are in NYC! If you want to stay really close to Times Square like we wanted, there is no way to avoid noise. Will definitely stay there on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Will go back and recommend”
Reviews.Author: MargieH4
Reviews.Content: Awesome room, close to everything and very clean. Most of the staff was very nice. Will probably go back in November.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Howardp
Reviews.Content: Stayed over a 4 day period in a superior room, which meant a double in one room and pull out couch in the other. All OK as it was only used to sleep in! Very convenient for Times Square etc

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a trade off....”
Reviews.Author: Wyliegal
Reviews.Content: The location is great. A short walk to Times Square and the retail on 5th ave. As a business traveller though it didn't meet my needs. There is a small rod inside the door with a few hangars that functions as the closet and no drawers to unpack my suitcase. The room is very tiny, though pleasantly decorated but there is no extra floor space for a suitcase to occupy for a week long stay. The worst part by far was the noise from the garbage trucks. I was awakened every day at 3:30am and it finally stopped around 6:30am. The rooms are also awkward to reach. I had to go through 3 sets of doors to reach mine. It is well priced for NYC for a weekend stay but would not stay here again for business.

Reviews.Title: “My new home in New York”
Reviews.Author: kellbert
Reviews.Content: Some of the reviews painted a less than rosy picture of the CQ, but I have a good review. I arrived here pretty tired after a long flight and taxi ride and the reception found a room for me quickly. The room was facing the street but there was no view as the air conditioner was high on the wall. The room was nicely furnished and enough space for one or two persons. There was a flat screen TV over the work desk that was easy to view from the bed and the bath. The bath has the usual amenities with a shower. Plenty of hot water when I needed it. The room was quiet and I slept well each night. Wake-up calls were reliable. The room and halls were clean and the elevators worked well. The Internet access was good. There was free bottled water on the lower floor (you had to fill the bottles from a machine) next to the gym. The location is excellent for access to Time Square and mid town shopping. The hotel had a check in machine (like an ATM) where you inserted your credit card and the room key and card showing your details were ejected quickly. No real need for a person - I liked this facility, but others want may want human assistance. All in all, I rate this hotel highly and would not hesitate to stay here again while visiting The Big Apple.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Susie4988
Reviews.Content: Location was great! Just 1 & 1/2 avenue blocks to times square. Service just ok! The hotel itself is poorly set up. To take advantage of the FREE water you need to go down an unmarked stair case with a door at the bottom and than weave in and around to get to the joke called a fitness room where the water is located. Literally 2 treadmills and 1 bike! When searching for your room, you enter the rickety old elevator that is the size of a telephone booth. You than proceed through several doors and short hallways to find your room. The hotel room was small but the furnishings were updated. Never experienced sheets that felt like paper before! Only 2 pillows on the bed and 2 towels for 2 people. Internet connection was in and out and frustrating in room. We were told that in order to get a taxi to airport in morning at 5:30 am we would have to walk to one of the avenues and hail one ourselves as they don't offer taxi service. They do however offer a private car for about same price as taxi. We took that to insure we would be on time. We stayed on the 11th floor and had a view of other buildings. The room we stayed in was quiet so we slept well. We wont stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CKapaun
Reviews.Content: I had seen the reviews before telling the single rooms would be very small, but I cannot confirm this. I booked "small single" and I was positively suprised because I could unpack, place my suitcase, walk around my room and all this. True were the stories about the window into a dark atrium between houses and the noise of the air condition, but it did not disturb me. I am have no trouble sleeping when there is a noise and I was only in my room when it was dark anyway. The furniture was not new, but it was okay and the bed was comfortable. I also enjoyed the free internet connection a lot. The room and the comfortable bathroom were clean like I always at Club Quarters hotels. The place is no wellness, luxury temple but the value for the money is hard to beat in this area so close to Times Square. Some guests before complained about a not so friendly staff, but I cannot confirm. Everybody was nice and friendly and helped me if I was needing help.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeNut05
Reviews.Content: Hotel overall was clean and the front desk were friendly and helpful. The day we arrived it was raining/snowing and two hotel workers watched my wife and I have difficulties getting our luggage out of the car and didn't offer to help. The rooms were small but it's to be expected in NYC. Had a flat screen TV the beds were alright (not like a Marriott/ Hilton bed). The location was great, right between Grand Central station and Times Square (2 blocks away for each). Also free wifi (unsecured) / internet (Ethernet port)

Reviews.Title: “Better than I thought!”
Reviews.Author: ATLtoEUR767
Reviews.Content: I booked the Club Quarters Midtown NYC via a popular travel website for an incredible low rate (almost $75 cheaper than other advertised hotels in the area) for our March 2011 trip. I thought this deal had to be too good to be true and after reading some of the reviews I was expecting the worst. However after arriving to the hotel and checking into the room we were very pleased with the staff and how nice the rooms were. In fact we booked a small single and the front desk upgraded us to a queen when they noticed it was two of us staying in the room. The room was very clean, modern, updated, and a nice size for a New York City hotel room. Oh, and to my surprise the internet was free and fast. The location was the best; we were within short walking distance to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Empire State, and much more. My only complaint about the hotel was the busy elevator, sometimes we waited for over 10 minutes to get down to the lobby from the 10th floor....next time I am asking for a low floor. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again and again on future trips to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Mroberts1954
Reviews.Content: Great Location! Yes, rooms are small but adequate for 2 people. I mean, its NYC... Get out of the room! Speedy check in. Requested a cot and it was surprisingly comfy. There are free apples and bottled water. The savings in water alone is significant! I checked out on St. Patrick's Day in the midst of the parade. The hotel suggested I use a car service due to the traffic issues and they booked the car and accompanied me and my luggage to 6th Ave. to meet the car. WHAT SERVICE!! Great job, guys! Would definitely stay here again. Should be a 4 star!

Reviews.Title: “Not For The Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: smartbiztravlr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Club Quarters once before for business and didn't remember it being such a bad stay. I arrived to 20 degree weather and a freezing cold room (65F) that did not warm up all night although I set the room temp to 80F. I found the following day that the window lock was broken off allowing the double hung window to slip and it had been open about an inch all night. The window unit did not stave off the cold. Room 517, if you get it check the window to see if it has been fixed. It's also a room in the front with the loud noise of trucks outside and immediately below the broken window starting at 4 am. Between the garbage trucks and the FedEx trucks loading; you can forget sleeping beyond 4am. The shower was warm but never hot and the shower stall could use re-tiling. I really did not have room for toiletries on the counter top either. The size of the room was smaller than the last one I had also with no luggage jack (not floorspace to set one up) and no space for a wardrobe; just a hook with a few hangars behind the door (not enough for three pairs of pants and three shirts let alone jackets). As business traveler I want a clean quiet room with good temperature control, a comfortable bed, a hot shower and a enough room for my belongings for the week. So I would not recommend it for the business traveler. If you get a cheap deal on a weekend as others have mentioned, it may be a good place for a single person to crash and catch a show. It is not big enough for two. It is convient to the theatre district and time square.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but does a great job for what it is designed to be”
Reviews.Author: djmarty2002
Reviews.Content: It is built to be a spartan, no extra frills business hotel and that is exactly what we found. The room was small but adequate for the time we were there for. The elevators are small but it gets you to your floor. The Coffee/juice table in the common area was great. The two computers in the same room for guests' use was great. The check in and check out process was automated using machines, which was new for me but fairly easy to use. Basically this is not a place to bring your family. If you are in town for a couple of nights, need a place to crash with a killer location that doesn't burn a hole in your pocket, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “No Bar”
Reviews.Author: nigel504158
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the New Year, Icould not believe the bar was'nt open on new years eve of all times. we will return to new york as we adore the place, but this hotel is just rubbish and was not worth the moneywe paid. fortunately we found a bar just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great Midtown Location, Basic Essentials for Business Travelers, No Frills”
Reviews.Author: RJFlyer
Reviews.Content: A client with a corporate membership put me up at this hotel during the holiday season when other hotels double or triple their rates. Typically, you must have a membership to stay during weeknights, but the property is open to the public on weekends. It offers all of the essentials for a business traveler and nothing more. The postives include a great location in the heart of midtown, tight security (must use a keycard to operate the elevator) and good works areas in the room. Now the negatives. The room is the smallest room I've experienced in NYC (where all rooms are small). The complimentary computer and printer loaded a nasty trojan virus onto my flash drive. Finally, the property feels very sterile - it has no warmth that you find in typical hotels. I did not eat at the restaurant or use the club facility, so I cannot speak to them. The property is fine if you are only looking for a safe place to sleep and work convenient to Midtown. If you have the option I would recommend the Club Quarters Opposite Rock Center, as it is a better property with an even better location.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Keith_in_London
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for six nights on a business trip to New York. Was really disappointed. Firstly, I should say that my expectations of a hotel when away on business in NYC are relatively basic. I want a hotel in midtown and clean room that I'm happy to be in (or at least not depressed by) with a comfortable bed for a good night's sleep. Pretty much the only other thing I want is breakfast that I can grab fairly quickly on my way to the office. The quality of the rooms here are below par. Furniture is ageing and needs updating, and oddly missing things like a wardrobe - a small open hanging rail in the corner instead, which would be fine in a roadside motel but not my home for a week when away on business. Shower room was tiny, but it was just me in the room so not a big deal. Cleanliness in the room was just okay - surfaces were clean but it needed a deep clean including the corners of the carpet. The shower room could have been cleaner - the shelves hadn't been wiped - but it wasn't so bad. One of the other killers for me was location. Not the general location as it is in a good midtown spot between Times Square and 5th Ave, but the micro-location was the big problem. I had a room at the front and at about 3.30 in the morning a loud refuse truck stops outside to take away the previous day's rubbish from the large hotel next door, whose rear-end is close to the front of this place. The noise is very loud indeed and went on for about half an hour. After this happened for the second night I moved rooms to the back, but be warned that if you do stay here, avoid rooms at the front. I can only really judge other service standards by the food. Firstly breakfast - I ate breakfast for three of my six days here. It was not good - no mean feat when there were only three of us in the dining room. The waiter stayed in the kitchen and didn't come out! I had to poke my head around the door after waiting so long to see if I could get served. This is really not very good when all I wanted was a basic standard of service e.g. get a pot of coffee. At the times he did appear (I can't recall if it was the same person each day or different people) everything was just too slow. The other food experience was room service. Jeesh - do not order food in the evening from the room service menu. My food was really not nice. The experience wasn't helped by it coming with throwaway plastic cutlery, which I guess tells you what you need to know about how seriously they take room service. However, you can (like in many hotels in Manhattan) order delivery from local restaurants so if you want food in your room then do this. The reason I can't really judge other service standards is I didn't get any. I'm not trying to be clever here - the only other times would have been check-in/check-out and the staff on the desk point you to self-service check-in machines to do the job. Great for an airport but for a hotel? Still - I checked in/out okay so I don't really have a beef towards the machine. However, after a long flight a bit of service goes a long way. This does matter when away on business (or it does to me, anyway) as I want a bit of a warm welcome from the place I'm staying when away from home and my family. My overall judgement is that this place needs to do one of two things. Either a full-on facelift to bring it up to standards of at least a reasonably good quality business hotel, which it is falling woefully short of right now. Or, change the branding and 'offer' to a basic place to stay for people on a budget but want to stay in midtown. This is not a hotel catering to the business traveller. I would only recommend it if you're on a budget and can calibrate your expectations down - particularly regarding budget if like some posters on here you can find a really cheap discounted deal on a travel website. Otherwise, avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and room”
Reviews.Author: NewYorker1102
Reviews.Content: Perfect for anything in NYC. You're right in the middle of the city, seconds away from Times Square and minutes away from Rockefeller center. Front desk staff is very helpful....I had the pleaseure of dealing with Angela and Mike who were extremely pleasant and helpful. Housekeeping did a great job. Rooms aren't the biggest in the world, but exactly what you expect from a NYC hotel room. Very pleased with the hotel and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have ever stayed, and I travel every week for business”
Reviews.Author: Sharaf_82
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worst hotel I have ever stayed. I travel every week for business to different cities. Recently I have a project in New York for couple of months and I stayed in Club Quarters Midtown for one week to try it. The room was very tiny with a A/C unit in the window. Bathroom was small. It took a good two minutes before hot water starts coming. Front desk has no supplies if you forgot something. The carpet condition was sickening. The elevators can four people if you really squeeze in. It took 20 minutes to warm up the room after turning on the heating, and next I left it on so I find it warm when I come in but the room service turned it off, which pissed me off super bad cause even the carpet was cold to walk on.........just horrible. The TV was a 20 inch computer monitor, and the room lighting was simply horrible. You can find much nicer hotels in NYC for the same price.......DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “It's all you need.......”
Reviews.Author: Cudrow1953
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from December 30 till January 2, 2011. The rooms were very comfortable, the service was excellent and the best part was the location. From here, it is a short walk to Times Square, subway stations, the Theatres, a sports bar and even a market. We had miminal street noise. It may have helped that we were on the 13th floor, but never the less, the hotel had a great atmospere and was all you need to send a great few days in the City. I will go back.........maybe not on New Years Eve, but that has nothing to do with the Club Quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel is putting it nicely.... It's a Business Dorm!”
Reviews.Author: FrancesHousemanRules
Reviews.Content: Don't expect any degree of service or common courtesy when staying at Club Quarters! You won't get it! Upon arrival, we were rudely shown how to "check yourselves in" (as if that's not the front desk's job). The world's tiniest rooms (no king beds folks!) and smallest bathrooms/showers possible! We had to stack our luggage (of 2 pieces) to fit in our room! Common necessities (iron/board/toiletries) are in a closet down the hall. No luggage service. And, the common room/lobby on the main floor is a "private club" - don't think about bringing outside food in! Don't relax lest you give the wrong impression. To boot, they charged my credit card extra for my spouse staying with me, even though I booked a "2 person room"... and then pushed me to "join the Club Quarters Club". I won't be back! Skip it! There are a million great hotels within steps of this dive!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonably clean, twin beds?!”
Reviews.Author: Jenpalex
Reviews.Content: Our room was nicely sized for NYC and clean enough. Bathtub was mildewy and had seen better days, but had great water pressure. We were traveling with our daughter, so got 2 beds. Unfortunately, they only have TWIN beds (not doubles, twin!). I can't remember the last time I stayed in a (US) hotel room with twin beds. FYI, there was plenty of room for a larger bed. Service at the front desk was good, we didn't encounter any of the nastiness/unhelpful treatment that others have. If you get a good rate (and only if), I'd recommend, but only if you're able to make the bed situation work.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job, but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: NHakim
Reviews.Content: The rooms were expectedly small, but very clean and made good use of space so you don't really feel "cramped" per se. The elevators were inconveniently tiny and slow. No more than a couple of people and a suitcase or two could fit. On our first day there was no hot water due to some mechanical issue. It was fixed in a reasonable amount of time, but my shower was very unpleasant. The free internet, coffee, bottled water and location made up for that. Our room was pretty quiet and we both slept soundly but I must say the bed was pretty hard and lacked pillows, although you can help yourself to an extra one from a closet down the hall. Check-out was as swift as check-in but very impersonal. The hotel kindly arranged a car for us to the airport but failed to notify us when it arrived. We only noticed it was there because I went outside looking for it when we started to worry about being late. Overall, the hotel is quite nice but the service is nothing to write home about. It's not that the staff were unfriendly or weren't attentive when approached, there were just no services offered. I suspect that's just the nature of a "business" hotel though and it didn't really bother us because we're pretty independent tourists anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very good location, avoid breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Cristi_Ionescu
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, just a few steps of Time Square and just a few meters from 5th Avenue. Reception guys were very polite and ready to help you with an advice. Room was fair (mine was 1013), but the view was to the interior courtyard; therefore I could saw only walls of bricks of another buildings â€“ however, cannot complain about that. But the room was nice, clean, and comfortable and heating really worked. The bathroom is in a good condition, you have all needed accessories. Two weak points: breakfast and TV channels. Breakfast was very poor and, probably as in most NY hotels is not included in the room charge. Itâ€™s 10 USD and I really not recommend it â€“ one morning the breakfast guy didnâ€™t show up at opening hour!!! Instead, I strongly recommend crossing the street and reaching a very, very convenient location where a very good breakfast waits for you. I paid 14-15 USD every morning and it really made sense. It's â€“ letâ€™s say a canteen â€“ but with lots of very good choices for breakfast from a heavy to a light one! Even the receptionist recommended this place! Similar as in other NY hotels, the TV channels were just a few â€“ so not too many options here â€“ generally US ones â€“ but you can live with it! Overall I do recommend this hotel. As long as youâ€™re next to 5th Avenue and Times Square, are you going to spend too much time in your room? :o) Enjoy NY!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Well Appointed Small Hotel with Parking Deal”
Reviews.Author: DianaID19
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is an excellent hotel, exceptionally well located. While the room was small, it had a queen sized bed, two night tables, a desk with ergonomic chair, a wardrobe and a chair. The bathroom had a shower, no bath, and was well appointed. Being a city person, I can sleep through anything and I always shut the blinds. You are about as centrally located as you can be - near the Diamond District, Met Life Bldg and Grand Central, Rockefeller Center, the Library, well you get the drift. For the price, this is an absolute bargain in NYC. And, the free computers along with free wifi is pretty amazing. Note, if you are parking a car, use the lot a block away they recommend, get your parking ticket validated and you get about a third off. (Yes, NYC parking rates are very high, but this is still a good deal.)

Reviews.Title: “Beware 3 am Garbage Pickup”
Reviews.Author: pocagrana
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Room 404, which overlooks 45th street. The room was okay, typical no-frills Club Quarters, but that's why you pay less. However, I was not prepared for the 3 am garbage collection process on the street, which lasted until 5 am or so, which is around the time that the delivery trucks show up, Due to the thin/old windows, the noise in my room was unbelievably loud, even if I had earplugs available, they wouldn't have made a difference. I was all ready to request a 50% discount on my room rate (since the room really was only truly available for sleeping 50% of the night), and instead decided to post here and provide a community service to my fellow travelers. I would have felt bad getting money back and then making a post. So there you have it. Rooms in back might be okay, wish I'd had one of those. Time for a nap....

Reviews.Title: “What a great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: easterbread
Reviews.Content: I was really leery of this hotel because I had read just as many negative reviews as positive ones online. Well, we loved our room! It was as quiet as a tomb and at the end of a hallway too. We faced the inner light well and not the street so I recommend this for quiet. Yes, the elevators are slow and tiny, but the place has a charm and a wonderful location. Not recommended for families but great for singles or couples. And the room was super clean and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room - no fear of bedbugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: PKaley
Reviews.Content: There's been so much hype over the bedbug infestation in NYC that I've heard of people cancelling trips! This was certainly unfounded at Club Quarters. The room was lovely and definitely a comfortable size. An added bonus was a small kitchenette area with a mini-fridge, microwave, sink and real dishes. The only drawback was that the window was surrounded on all sides by hotel walls; although it was daylight, sunshine never shone through the windows. We used the computers in the business center and had no problem connecting, and took advantage of fresh coffee available in the lobby in the morning. The lobby bar was never open during our stay - it would have been nice to stop for a cocktail. Bed was comfortable and everything was exceptional clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in great location”
Reviews.Author: Lafayette1
Reviews.Content: This is a nice small hotel located a few blocks from Times Square. The room was a nice size. The bed could have been a bit more comfortable and our room did not have a bathtub. Other than that, we had a good experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in proximity to Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: dizystarrs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Club Quarters Midtown from Oct 1-4. The location is the best part of the hotel. It is within walking distance almost everything in Midtown. Times Square was only a 5 minute walk and Rockefeller Plaza was only about a 10 minute walk. I recommend getting breakfast at the cafe across the street- amazing! The rooms were on the smaller side but not nearly as bad as I expected based on other reviews I read. We had a kinda crappy view of an alley and barbed wire fence next to the hotel but what does it really matter, I can quickly go to Times Square and see the lights instead of looking out the window! Check in/out was very quick and there was always someone at the front desk. They even allowed us to check in about 3 hours early for no extra charge, and held our bags when we checked out. They have 2 computers in the lounge that can be used at anytime, which was nice. We were able to keep an eye on the weather and make sure we knew where we were going. They also have free coffee and bottled water in the lobby. Overall it was a nice clean hotel in a good location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “True to the reviews I read!!!”
Reviews.Author: MelDan64
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to New York for his birthday and the reviews I read were accurate. The rooms are small as expected for NY, but clean, the elevators are extremely small, short walk to the theater district and Times Square. We stayed in Room 813 and although there wasn't a pleasant window view, the room was very quiet. Would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel in a good location at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: RMurray847
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights here (July 2 & 3, 2010) and it was a very nice experience. Was it spectacular? No, not even close. But we had proper expectations, and were not disappointed. I see from its web site that Club Quarters talks about "being a member" but this was never something that came up for us. We booked through a large travel web site (the one with the gnome) and got the room for $146 per night. For a hotel just two blocks from the heart of Times Square, this is a pretty darn good deal. The hotel is unassuming from the outside, and has a small but attractive lobby. The street it is on is quiet (on 45th between 5 & 6th). We heard no traffic noise from our 9th floor window overlooking 45th st. As I said, a couple of avenues west and we were on Times Square. Two blocks north and we were at the Diamond District and Radio City, St. patricks and 30 Rock were just a block or two north of that. A location just one block or so more west and north would have been $100 a night more. So unless you object to even the most minimal walking, the location is great if you're in town for some theatre. We were also quite close to the NY Public library and Bryant Park. Our room was small...big surprise. In case you weren't aware, hotel rooms in NYC are small. Yes, you can pay some serious money and get more typically sized rooms...but as I said, we had realistic expectations. Our little room contained a queen bed, and extra chair, a small desk, a rod for hanging clothes (no closet) and a small bedroom with a shower but no tub. HOWEVER, the design was very tasteful (especially in the bathroom, nice fixtures and a great frosted glass door) and the room was very clean. We spent a grand total of perhaps 5 waking hours in the room and perhaps 13 sleeping hours...and we really didn't need more from our room than a place for our stuff and a comfortable night's sleep. If you're traveling with a family, no doubt you would have been cramped where we were. But the room, while not exactly spa-style romantic, was actually quite a nice place to return to after a LONG day wandering around the greatest city on Earth! (And the AC, which is provided by a window unit, actually worked well and was quiet!! That might be a first for a window unit in a hotel.) There is a continental breakfast (which is NOT free...what hotels in NYC provide FREE meals???), and a fairly dressy looking restaurant...but we did not avail ourselves and I cannot comment. Cons: the TV in the room is 20 inches and hangs over the desk, a fair distance from the bed, where you are likely to be trying to watch it. Again, for a quick stay, it was fine for having the news on in the background. But if you'd try to watch a whole movie or TV show, it would have felt small. The bathroom works great for ONE person, but is simply too tiny for two people to share a sink or mirror. Front desk service was impersonal, but not annoyingly so. They were responsive, but not exactly overjoyed either. HOWEVER, when we called for our luggage that they'd been holding for us on our last afternoon, it took a full 10 minutes for it to arrive. THAT was annoying, because we needed to get to the airport. They have an ice machine and free bottled water...but ONLY at the basement level, in their tiny workout room. We used it once, and it was a minor pain. But overall, we had a very nice stay, and I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A small, dark dorm room.”
Reviews.Author: jd294
Reviews.Content: If this hotel's rooms had a voice, it would be Philip Seymour Hoffman's from the film Happiness. My room was small and dark with old blankets and frayed carpet--a depressing contrast to the grand old lounge and breakfast room. The service was not good either. When I called the front desk to ask for an iron and ironing board, the man who answered instructed me to help myself to the housekeeping closet down the hall. Having to help myself was bad enough, but when I got to the closet I found only towels and toiletries. So I had to call again and get someone to truly help me. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: kgfisher
Reviews.Content: Stayed at CQ Midtown from Sept 5-7, 2010. Rooms are VERY small, maybe 150 sq feet total. This may not be that bad for NYC but it's pretty small for me. Bathroom only had pocket door and did not provide much privacy. Location is excellent, 5 minute walk to Times Square and Theater Distrct. Staff was OK, but would not even help us with a larger cab booking...strange. Booked through Travelocity and rate was much better than booking directly throug hotel

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for exploring 5th Ave and Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Dan G
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned when we first arrived at this hotel, the lobby was tiny and you checked in on a touch screen (with the help of the friendly staff) But the room was a good size, bed was comfy and shower worked well. There was a fridge and a microwave in the room as well as a flat screen TV with various cable channels. There was even free bottled water in the fitness studio which was a godsend as it was 88 degrees outside. The best thing about this hotel was the location, go down 45th street one way and you end up on Times Square, go the other way and you were on 5th Avenue. Ideal for all the tourist attractions. Central park was only a 20min walk away. Overall a very good hotel in a great location. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location for sight seeing”
Reviews.Author: SHAH21_86
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 4 night stay in this hotel. I was a bit worried at first from reading previous reviews, but do not be put off. The hotel was just what we wanted, clean, spacious and close to everything, especially times square, just 2 blocks away. We walked everywhere around New York and went as far as ground zero. The room was spacious as we had a studio room, so had a fridge and microwave, which was handy. There was a hairdryer in the bathroom. There is free wifi, chilled bottled water, tea and coffee, which we thought was a bonusd. Easy check in/check out. Reception staff helpful. We asked for two extra pillows and they were brought to the room within 10 mins, which i thought was good. Would definately stay here again if visiting New York.

Reviews.Title: “Plesantly Surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: BrianHill
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. I booked it last minute for a night in NYC & Times square. It's a few blocks from the heart of Times Square, and a very short walk. I checked in around 8pm, and the front desk was very professional and helpful. The rooms are good, mine was a single queen room, with a sleek modern decor. It's NYC so the space is limited, but the layout is effective for the bed, a desk, a queen bed, wardrobe, and bathroom. They had free, fast, password free, wifi. Free & unlimited bottled water, with a cool dispensing machine. I selected this hotel b/c it had a mini-gym. Which I used the next morning. Thy gym was small but enough for an enjoyable workout, also free water & extra towels. During my stay I requested extra towles, which arrived within that hour. I requested a cot for a friend, which was free. I had asked for a late check-out, which they said would be an extra $35. I thought it was odd for a free cot, and a charged late check out. Overall I was impressed, the hotel was almost booked out, buy still I was able to get a great room. I'd recommend it and stay there again. There are a TON of hotels to choose from in NYC, but my experience would bring me back or stay at another Club Quarters hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mazzamca
Reviews.Content: I was very reluctant to stay in this hotel after feedback from my colleages and reviews on TripAdvisor. Well, it wasn't as bad as I feared - but still not great. The best feature of this hotel is this location - close to Times Square and Grand Central - so perfect for tourists. I'd say the worst feature is the terrible staff. I travel to NY regularly and have never met so sour, unfriendly NY staff EVER! My room was very small and dark, although it was clean. I prefer to have a bath in my room but as far as I can tell they ony have showers. I have also stayed in the Downtown Clubquarters and the standard of services/ rooms is much higher - although the location is not so good.

Reviews.Title: “No Cover on Mattress and Possible Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Turquoise20
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here one night. We were pleased with the location, size of the room, and price, BUT we woke up at 4am to catch a flight home and we each had bites on our bodies. I had bites on my arm, leg, and back. He had a similar looking bite on his arm. Five years ago I encountered bed bugs in Fiji, so I know the warning signs. We bagged our luggage and washed all our clothes when we got home. What blew us both away was that when we checked the mattress there was NO cover on the mattress, of any kind. We didn't find any bugs, so the only evidence we have is the bites on both our bodies. I had incorrectly assumed that all nice hotels in NYC were protecting their mattresses from bed bugs and any other kind of stain, but there was NOTHING. I called the hotel and told them about our experience and their response was that they would have housekeeping look into it and I have not heard back from them. I would never stay in a hotel in NYC that did not put protective covers on their mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “some very small rooms but a great location”
Reviews.Author: Chets_9
Reviews.Content: the hotels location is fantastic, between 5th and 6th avenues. great if your a toursit, 5 streets away from the Rockefeller centre and a few minutes from the empire state building. pricing for new york standards is good, but your paying for what you get, very tiny rooms and even smaller bathrooms. if your ok spending lots of time out of your room then this is a good choice, otherwise i dont reccomend it

Reviews.Title: “Generally pleased but a few quibbles”
Reviews.Author: mick39
Reviews.Content: Won this hotel on a Priceline bid for 4 nights in July. I was a little worried after reading some reviews, mostly about possible lack of air conditioning. My window unit air conditioner worked fine. It presented no problems but I did not stay during the heat wave either. We were getting highs around 90 and the a/c managed just fine. I arrived at 8 a.m. and was not allowed to check in early, even though a gentleman just ahead of me was clearly allowed to do this. The front desk is more of a kiosk and the staff person was not friendly or welcoming in the least. I think you have to join some sort of club to get special privileges at this chain of hotels. It did not strike me as having the amenities you would expect to see at a 3 star hotel, like a properly staffed front desk, bellmen in the lobby, and things like that. I was directed to come back after 2 o'clock and I did and was given a key to my room on the 11th floor. The two elevators are tiny and slow, but the waits were not too bad when I was there. The room was small (expected that) but it had a nice, modern look and feel and the bed was comfortable. Everything was very clean, including the bathroom. The shower was great. Nice soaps and shampoos in the bathroom. Small window with not much of a view. The television was very small and there was no channel guide. Also no pay per view movies. Very strange set up with the television. Never did quite figure it out. Not like any hotel cable television I've ever experienced. Housekeeping was quite good and were the only staff there that I found to be friendly. Virtually ignored by the rest of the staff the entire time. Very strange experience in that regard. Location could not be better and makes up for a lot. This place is in a prime location near Times Square and Rockefeller Center. Great places to eat all around. Great shopping on 5th Avenue close by. I would stay here again just for the location. It's located on a relatively quiet street and I had no problem sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: severity845
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend with my gf. Isn't much to look at from the outside, but inside is simple and clean. Asked for a room with a queen bed, but there was only a double. The hotel did remove the additional charge at checkout without incident. The room was small but they definitely maximized the space so it doesn't feel crowded at all. bed was comfortable and the bathroom well-apportioned. The location is great. you are only a couple blocks from times square and grand central. I booked on priceline and was concerned because i hadn't heard of this place but was pleasantly surprised. A nice touch was the chilled water dispenser (and free plastic bottles). That really came in handy in july. Parking is validated at a garage a block over for $22 a day. Definitely recommend this hotel for a stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - close to Time Square, 5th Avenue & Broadway”
Reviews.Author: Heidi S
Reviews.Content: Got a decent rate on Priceline. Room small but adaquate and expected for New York. Clean. Two girlfirends hitting the big city so the two single beds were awesome. Friendly & helpful staff. 2 computers to use in business area. Free bottled water downstairs in exercise room. Air conditioning but as we were there during a major heat wave, it worked hard. No view but very quiet - no street noise at all. Didn't use hotel restaurant facilities but great place to eat breakfast & lunch across the street (Cafe Manhattan). It had great fresh food and good prices. Starbucks also across the street. Totally recommend it as a choice for 1st timers to New york

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Denny820
Reviews.Content: It's 3 blocks from Times Square and very easy to access from the Lincoln Tunnel. They have an arrangement with a parking garage a few blocks away to park for $22 for 24 hours; a great deal. The staff was friendly and the room was clean. The room was small but exactly what I expected for such a great price. Actually, it was a little nicer than expected because the room did not have an 'old' feel to it. Wouldn't hesitate staying here again, in fact I plan on it.

Reviews.Title: “OK, not great”
Reviews.Author: dlynnsor
Reviews.Content: Got the hotel on Priceline at a bit of a discount (not much). Room is a bit larger than the usual NYC hotel. No service staff--bellmen, concierge, doormen (or cab-getters).
